\[ F_1 = F_2 = 1, \]
and for \( n > 2 \),
\[ F_n = F_{n-1} + F_{n-2}.\]
Now, observe that any element in the Fibonacci sequence except when \( k \) equals one appears exactly once anywhere in consecutive positions beginning immediately following index \( k \):
